intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Hmmm, so clever little Corrin has returned home. And he/she has carried out my order in an alarmingly competent fashion, no less. Heh heh heh... well done, child. Mwahahahaha. HA HA HA HA! Well, I'll just have to give my dear son/daughter a truly agonizing mission now, won't I?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: ... You may enter.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon, Corrin has returned. It seems he/she managed to quell the rebellion without sacrificing a single life. He/She has requested an audience with you, my liege. What should I tell him/her?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Tell him/her I received the message and will be there momentarily.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Consider it done, your majesty.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I have returned, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: And gloriously so, I might add. Iago told me of your impressive feat. Stopping a rebellion without taking a single life is no small accomplishment. You've done well, Corrin. I am... proud of you. As promised, I now welcome you back into the royal family. Well done, my son/daughter.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Father! I can't tell you how much this means to me.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: I told you all would be well in the end. Good job, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thanks, Xander!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Ehem, there is one small problem, King Garon. My sources tell me Corrin did not carry out his/her mission alone.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Iago! That was unnecessarily cruel, even for you.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Is this true, Corrin. Did you or did you not face the Ice Tribe alone?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: ... It is true. I did not face them alone. I set out on my own, as ordered, but along the way I ran into trouble. Felicia/Jakob, Silas and Elise came to help me. I couldn't have done it without them. I'm sorry for defying you in that regard, Father. I beg your forgiveness.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: So you defined my holy orders and involved not only retainers but also your sister?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: This behavior simply cannot be tolerated. Right, King Garon? He/she betrayed the wishes of the divine dragon, Anankos. Such sacrilege demands a swift and severe punishment. If you ask me, we should put an end to Corrin once and for all.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Stop it, Iago! That's never gonna happen! I won't let it! Corrin never asked us to follow him/her - we did that on our own! It's not his/her fault! So... s-so if the punishment is death, you'll have to kill me too.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise! Don't say that, dear sister. I'm not worth dying for.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Quiet, both of you. Father, if you must punish someone, punish me. It was I who told the others to tag along and help Corrin with his/her mission. If death is the price for this indiscretion, it is I, and I alone, who will pay it.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Hmmm...

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Father, kill me or kill no one. That is all there is to it.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Enough. I have no intention of harming any of my beloved children. Though it was not exactly as I requested, he/she did accomplish his/her mission. By the grace of Anankos, I shall let this pass. He/She is, after all, still my son/daughter.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon! You can't mean that!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Father! And you, Xander. Thank you for looking out for me, even at the risk of your own life.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Think nothing of it, little prince/princess. Such is the duty of an older brother.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I must admit, my child, I never thought you would pull off such a grand feat. Given your ability for combat, I shall waste no time in assigning you a new mission.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: A new mission? So soon?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Skills like yours need to be put to good use. I'd like you to head for Notre Sagesse. I need you to capture that territory and bring it under Nohrian rule.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Notre Sagesse, eh? As you wish, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I have heard that the place is even now teaming with Hoshidan soldiers. The Hoshidans are taking steps to topple Nohr and all we hold dear. Such bad seeds must not be allowed to take root. Head there immediately and eradicate all Hoshidan soldiers you find along the way.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Y-you want me to fight against the Hoshidan army?!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: That's not a problem, is it? Or, after all that, are you reluctant to raise a sword against the kingdom of your birth?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: N-no problem at all. I am a Nohrian, through and through. I will carry out your mission without fail, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Good. Do not let me down, son/daughter. I'm counting on you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I won't fail you, Father.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, I'm off on another daring mission, ha ha. So for now, this is good-bye.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Take care, Corrin. Even when we are apart, know we are still with you in spirit.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Oh, it just doesn't seem fair! Going on a mission like that with such a small army. I'd go with you, but Father tasked us with a mission of our own. I really wish there was something we could do to help...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Don't worry, Camilla. We'll be fine on our own. Right, Elise?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Yeah, that's right! We'll be just dandy! With me and my retainers at your side, we'll be back home in no time flat!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Elise is going too? Now I'm really worried. It was nice knowing you, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: HEY! That's not funny, Leo! Why would you say such a terrible thing?!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ha ha, he's just trying to get a rise out of you, Elise. You know I'm counting on you.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Thanks, Corrin! That's why you're my favorite! Because you aren't mean and stupid like Leo!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Even after spending time on the battlefield, you're somehow still the same spoiled brat. It's actually quite impressive. See, Elise? I'm not mean at all. I just said you impress me.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: XANDER! MAKE LEO STOP TEASING ME!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: *sigh* Corrin, listen well. The mysterious Rainbow Sage resides in Notre Sagesse. He grants divine power to those he deems worthy. Seek him, if you have the courage.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow, is that so? I never knew such a being existed, much less in Notre Sagesse. But wait... if you know about him, does that mean YOU received divine power?!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: It is true. Father and I each visited the sage and were each gifted with his power.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Th-that's incredible.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: It was a great honor. However, be aware that you will have to face severe trials first. If you decide to seek out the sage's trials, make sure you're prepared.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see. Thank you for your advice, Xander. I must become as strong as possible so that I can end this war once and for all. I have no choice but to seek out the sage and face whatever trials he has in store.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: As expected. I look forward to seeing that new power when you return safely.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Xander. Well, I suppose I had better get going. Good-bye, everyone!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Best of luck, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Oh, my little Corrin... please be careful.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That fort up ahead is enormous! Silas, are we supposed to pass through that?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: We are. The road that leads to port is on the other side.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Amazing. It kind of looks like a gigantic sleeping dragon.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Heehee, you're so keen, Corrin! That place is called Fort Dragonfall. It's some big 'ol dragon that died a long time ago.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Fort Dragonfall... Tell me more, Elise.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Sure! Well, rumor has it this dragon was incredibly powerful. They say when it died, it's body eventually became this very fort!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So this was a dragon from a long time ago... How very awe inspiring.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: It is, isn't it? But the fort is now occupied by the Hoshidan army. We'll have to fight them off if we want to get through.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Fate is cruel, isn't it? Well, I suppose we have no choice. We must get to Notre Sagesse so I can complete my mission and find the sage. I'll have to face the Hoshidan army eventually. It's now or never. I'm ready. I... I can do this.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Understood. In that case, let's prepare for battle before they spot us.

battle.speaker: Nyx
battle.line: What a nuisance. I might have known the Hoshidan army would be here. "There's a young girl in there! We've got to take her into custody!" Blah blah blah. Children barely out of the womb out to capture a grown woman. Pathetic. It makes me sick. This is why I usually choose to remain hidden from the ignorant masses. *sigh*

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Once again, here I am. Dragged to some horrible place with no explanation. *sigh* Is it my destiny to forever be tossed aside, a stranger to all lands? Maybe the Nohrians will accept me. Or maybe this is where I die... Well, it is out of my control. If only I were a Hoshidan by birth. I knew if and when the war began, I would be among the first casualties. At least in the end... Hm? Is that... a Dragon Vein I sense? Ah, I do recall hearing that this fort was built from the remains of a dark dragon. Perhaps it can be used to attack those within the fort...

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Hey, miss! What are you doing out here?! You're definitely not a Hoshidan soldier. It's dangerous out here, young lady. Come on over to our side, and we'll protect you. Your family must be worried sick.

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: I am no "young lady", and I neither desire nor require your paltry protection.

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: Are you as deaf as you are dumb, boy/girl? Begone before I curse you into oblivion.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Boy/Girl?! You're one to talk! You look about the same age as my little sister!

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: Appearances can be deceiving, boy/girl. I'm afraid my situation is beyond your ability to comprehend. All I want is to live in solitude and to avoid the harsh gaze of the world around me... Is that really too much to ask?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Live in solitude? Does that mean... you're all alone? Don't you have a family?

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: My family left a very long time ago. They were... frightened of me and my abilities. They thought I was strange... Maybe I am. Who needs a family, anyway? I-I'm not sure why I told you all that... your eyes are very trustworthy and calming. So yes, intrusive stranger. I am all alone and shall remain so for all my days.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: No, I can't accept that. Why don't you join my team? We'll be your family from now on.

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: What are you saying?! You know nothing about me or my dark past.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: That's true, but that doesn't matter. Only the present and the future. Besides, you can't evade the Hoshidan army all by yourself. You need us. Trust me, I know what it's like to feel lost and alone. That's no way to live. If my friends and family hadn't come to my aid, I wouldn't be alive right now. Everyone needs someone to lean on, stranger. Please join us.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: I really shouldn't leave such a helpless little lady alone, anyway, haha.

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: I already told you I'm much older then I appear! Insolent fool. Or perhaps that was... what was it called... a "humorous joke" of some sort? Hmmm... Maybe you have a point. I suppose it would be advantageous to join you. For now. It has been a long while since I had any sort of companionship. It might be... nice. Well, fine. Since you insist, I shall join your ranks. Use my powers as you see fit.

recruit-talk.speaker: Nyx
recruit-talk.line: Oh, since we're on the same side now, I should let you in on a little secret. See that wall over there? It has a weak spot. It should break if you attack it. That knowledge should help us prevail over the Hoshidan Army.

boss.speaker: Haitaka
boss.line: Hey there, Nohrian pawn. Care for a little lesson in Hoshidan combat?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Hello, Corrin. It's nice to see you again.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's nice to see you too, Azura. But what are you doing in Nohr? Actually, never mind that part. Why were the Hoshidans fighting against you? I thought the people of Hoshido were your allies.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: As did I. But when the war started, everything changed. After you, A prince/princess of Hoshido, sided with Nohr, the Hoshidans wished to banish me. The general consensus was that nobody with ties to the enemy could be trusted. Since I was taken from Nohr as a child, I bore the brunt of these wild suspicions.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura... that's awful.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Ryoma and the others stood up for me. They tried their best to protect me. But one day a group of Hoshidan soldiers captured me and took me here. If you hadn't come along, I can't imagine what would have become of me. So thank you, Corrin. I owe you my life.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Please don't thank me, Azura. It's my fault you were caught up in all this to begin with. It's not fair that you were torn from your home again on my account. I'm so sorry.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Please don't blame yourself. It's really not your fault. When a war starts, it's only natural to distrust the enemy. I always knew this would happen if Nohr and Hoshido ever went to war.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I suppose so. But I'm still sorry for the part I played in your misfortune.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Think nothing of it. Actually... If it's not too much of a burden, I was hoping you would allow me to join you. Perhaps with our powers combined we can end this senseless war.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Of course! Would be honored to have you fight by my side. You were a valued friend during my time in Hoshido. I'm happy to return the favor.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Thank you, Corrin. I'm so glad we crossed paths once more. After I was captured, I couldn't stop thinking about you. Not just you, but also your... Oh, never mind.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Corrin! I finally found you! We're all ready to go now.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thanks, Elise. We'll leave momentarily.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Um, brother/sister? Who is this pretty lady you're talking to?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: This is Azura. She'll be traveling with us from now on. She was once a Nohrian Princess, but she was stolen away many years ago.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: A Nohrian princess? Really? Wow! Oh, wow! Why didn't you say so? Does that mean you're my big sister?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ha ha! Of course it does! Isn't that right, Azura?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Well, um...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura, is something wrong? You seem-

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: I have a sister named Azura! And she's SO PRETTY! It's nice to meet you, sis!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes, it's a p-pleasure to meet you as well. Thank you for the warm welcome, Elise.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Tee hee hee, no problem! Oh my goodness! I'm all shy now because of my new big sis! Come on already! Follow me! I wanna be the one to introduce you to everyone!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Huh? Oh, my...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Elise, Azura is a bit shy. Please don't overwhelm her. ELISE?! Azura... what a mystery you are. It was almost like she was about to say she and Elise weren't really sisters. Perhaps it was just my imagination...
